body.name: Local Woman Missing
body.description: New York Times Best Seller"Dark and twisty, with white-knuckle tension and jaw-dropping surprises." (Riley Sager, New York Times best-selling author of Home Before Dark)In this smart and chilling thriller, master of suspense Mary Kubica takes domestic secrets to a whole new level, showing that some people will stop at nothing to keep the truth buried.People don't just disappear without a trace....Shelby Tebow is the first to go missing. Not long after, Meredith Dickey and her six-year-old daughter, Delilah, vanish just blocks away from where Shelby was last seen, striking fear into their once-peaceful community. Are these incidents connected? After an elusive search that yields more questions than answers, the case eventually goes cold.Now, 11 years later, Delilah shockingly returns. Everyone wants to know what happened to her, but no one is prepared for what they'll find....Look for these other riveting thrillers by Mary Kubica: The Good Girl Pretty Baby Don't You Cry Every Last Lie When the Lights Go Out The Other Mrs. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thriller and suspense
reviews.reviewText: This was really good. I liked the characters a lot. Just when I was sure I knew how it would end, I became pleasantly surprised with a plot twist.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good but there was much more I craved
reviews.reviewText: I devoured the book in 3 days! I love her writing but there are several things that I need answers too.Who was tailgating Bea and Kate?Who was outside the house that Cassandra Saw?Who is Grace's Father?What happened to Dr. Feingold and why was he lying about knowing Meridith?Lots of things left unresolved in my opinion

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Such a great read! I have recently found myself rising high out of a book slump and between this and Hidden Pictures by Jason Rekulak, I have been deeply entangled with a new found love for thriller, mystery, and suspense. This book is 100% all of that, you will NEVER see it coming!! Recommended to all lovers of the heart-skipping suspense!! Just ordered my second book by this author, can’t wait to get my hands on it!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was hooked from page 2. The timeline jumps around which I liked. I definitely did not have this figured out right away. There were twists and turns and an ending that I did not expect.I would 10/10 recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Twisty but plotholes...
reviews.reviewText: I gave this 4 stars because I think what could have been great storytelling was overshadowed by some serious plot holes and a rushed ending. I want to say first, that I liked the idea of who the antagonist turned out to be but the ending overall seemed rushed and completely far fetched. No spoilers but those who read it, music studio really? For all that time? Also, without giving too much away, the detective and the DNA test? Yea right that was so far fetched it was almost laughable. The author would have been better off having the reader wait for the DNA results to come back than to add that unnecessary twist for even more shock value. It didn't work and was insulting to one's intelligence. Another huge let down (without revealing who) is how the police ruled and closed two very suspicious deaths in a neat little bow and didn't investigate further? Also I felt like there were things thrown into the story and never explained just because...Who were the two people outside of Meredith's house that Cassandra saw?Who was the car following Bea and Kate?Was Marty and Shelby having an affair?Don't get me wrong, despite everything mentioned above I enjoyed this book alot. I think if it were tweaked a little and didnt have a rush ending this could have been brilliant. I would still recommend but if you read you will have questions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love a good “whodunnit”. And this was pretty good. The book goes back and forth a lot for timelines - which I liked. The ending was not predictable throughout the entire book. But I definitely had some inkling the last several chapters. And I’m always a little disappointed when I know what’s going to happen at any point. This is a VERY descriptive book. The kind that takes pages to describe the weather. That gets old. I found myself skipping many paragraphs I knew were just descriptive. A little annoying. But it did allow me to finish it in just two days because I could skip so much.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Had other things to do today but I had to finish this book! Keeps you guessing with an ending you couldn't see coming!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Thriller that keeps you want to keep reading!Loved the twists!Fast ending, but it was a good read!

reviews.reviewTitle: It may be a bit confusing in the beginning ,but just be patient ,it gets better .
reviews.reviewText: This is my second novel of hers ,it was a little hard to catch on at first ,but now I can't put it down .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Oh my, this book had my heart racing, I couldn't wait to come back to it, you won't be disappointed

El libro ha llegado con pegamento y papel pegado en la parte de atrás, al quitárselo se ha dañado el libro. Horrible.The book came with something sticky on the back and cardboard stack to it, when I wiped it off the paper got damaged. Sincerely disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Unputdownable - finished it literally in one sitting. so good!
reviews.reviewText: This book will get you out of any reading slump. The twists are spectacular! Definitely one of the best thrillers I‘ve read this year.
Er hangt een stuk karton aan de cover en de hoek is beschadigd
